cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles south-southwest of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north along Florida’s west coast tonight, turning north-northeast on Wednesday and accelerating northeastward across the southeastern United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north Florida Gulf Coast near the Steinhatchee River

weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm-surge and hurricane warnings confined to Florida’s west coast from Bonita Beach northward to the Aucilla River; no warnings for the southeast Florida coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west coast (Bonita Beach to Aucilla River including Tampa Bay), Big Bend, coastal Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Brief squalls with gusts 25–35 mph possible Tuesday evening through early Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side of south Florida
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could total 2–4 inches with isolated higher amounts, causing ponding on terminal surfaces and minor street flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in outer rainbands; lightning and temporary visibility reduction could interrupt crane and vessel operations
